alert.note: Alert for Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 22 at 1:30PM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 11 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM Thursday to 11 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
